reviews.text: As a company owner and van driver I hardly get on public transport but today at purfleet station at around 10am the lady at the ticket office and the guy on the platform went that extra mile without hesitation to help even righting down the correct information thanks for making my journey quick and easy keep up the good customer service.

Pleasant station with semi-rural atmosphere. Half-hourly services in each direction and plenty to keep waiting passengers amused, including level-crossing at southern end of platforms and regular passing freight trains. Ticket office (not always open), toilet and small car park on westbound side. Parking here and in immediate vicinity of station extremely limited. Good wheelchair access.
I would like to thank Elena for helping me find my lost bag. She was very kind and did everything she can until we finally found it at Pitsea station. Thank you Elena!
The level crossing was down for 15 minutes before a train came! The shortest I've ever seen has been 5 minutes. The train is probably not even at the previous station by that point.
Wayne was extremely helpful finding me the cheapest ticket for my journey even after I'd paid.
